subject: AI & Agents
title: Emergent Abilities: What Scale Unlocks
description: A quick win: understand Emergent Abilities: What Scale Unlocks.

hook.text: A 1B model can't do arithmetic. A 100B model can. Nobody explicitly taught it.

buildup.text: Emergent abilities are skills that appear suddenly at certain model scales.

discovery.text: Examples: multi-step reasoning, code generation, translation between rare languages.

twist.text: Some researchers argue emergence is a measurement artifact, not a real phase transition.

climax.text: Regardless of cause, larger models reliably unlock capabilities smaller ones lack.

quiz.question: What are emergent abilities?
options: Skills that appear at larger model scales
